definition: (of aircraft) to take off and land

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
to drop/to fall/to come down/to descend

sentences.english: Helicopters and other VTOL aircraft normally have an avoidance curve.
sentences.chinese: 直升機和其他垂直起降飛機通常避免曲線。

sentences.english: As the aircraft have now VTOL dynamics at all.
sentences.chinese: 由於飛機現已在各垂直起降動力。

sentences.english: Constant current regulator (CCR) is to provide visual guidance for aircraft taking off and landing.
sentences.chinese: 恆流調光器是爲飛機起降提供目視引導的關鍵設備。

sentences.english: Phoenix International Airport, many flights taking off and landing are forced to delay or cancel.
sentences.chinese: 鳳凰城國際機場許多起降班機都因此被迫延後或取消。

sentences.english: It has even landed and taken off from a carrier deck without benefit of arresting gear or catapults.
sentences.chinese: 它甚至能夠使用彈射器和沒有制動裝置的甲板上起降。

sentences.english: The rotor wing produces lift during VTOL, using aerodynamics.
sentences.chinese: 該旋翼產生的電梯在垂直起降，利用空氣動力學。

sentences.english: This is applied to clients with above 200 movements per year.
sentences.chinese: 適用於一年200次以上起降的客戶。

sentences.english: We have put detents in the STOVL stick.
sentences.chinese: 我們已經將閉鎖裝置設計到了垂直起降杆裏。

definition: opportunity in a battle/fighter aircraft/war secret
